nodes.title: The Proposition
nodes.story: They corner you at the office holiday party, breath smelling of whiskey. 'My marriage is dead. Yours looks miserable. We could make each other happy. No one has to know.'

choices.text: Laugh it off as a joke
Whisper: 'Meet me in the supply closet'

nodes.title: The First Time
nodes.story: Amongst the boxes and office supplies, their hands are everywhere. 'Shhh,' they whisper as you bite your lip to stay quiet. This is wrong. This is electric.

choices.text: Push them away - this is a mistake
Kiss them harder, hungry for more
Agree to meet somewhere private later

nodes.title: Hotel Room Secrets
nodes.story: You check in under fake names. The room smells like cleaning products and sin. 'No strings, just this,' they say, already unbuttoning your shirt.

choices.text: Leave money on the bed and exit

nodes.title: Double Life
nodes.story: Months pass. You're lying to your partner about 'late meetings.' They're lying about 'business trips.' The guilt is a constant ache, but the thrill is addictive.

choices.text: End it and confess to your partner
Ask them to leave their spouse

nodes.title: The Aftermath
nodes.story: Your partner leaves. Your friends know. Your job is awkward. You're alone in your half-empty apartment, wondering if it was worth it.

nodes.title: Living the Lie
nodes.story: Years pass. You're both still with your original partners, still meeting in secret. The spark is gone, replaced by routine and resentment. You're trapped.
